sentences.sContent: Shortly before the uninhabited space station reached orbit in .May 1973,aeroaynamic pressure ripped off a meteoroid and heat shield.
sentences.sContent_eng: Shortly before the uninhabited space station reached orbit in .May 1973,aeroaynamic pressure ripped off a meteoroid and heat shield.
sentences.sCn: 在1973年5月无人空间站到达轨道前不久，空气动力压力扯破了一个流星体和挡热板。 分析：首先，从逻辑上看，说：“空气动力压力扯破了一个流星体”，是不合事理的，荒谬可笑的。

sentences.sContent: When a meteoroid enters the atmosphere of the earth (becoming a meteor), it is actually the speed compressing the air in front of the object that causes it to heat up.
sentences.sContent_eng: When a meteoroid enters the atmosphere of the earth (becoming a meteor), it is actually the speed compressing the air in front of the object that causes it to heat up.
sentences.sCn: 流星体闯入地球的大气层（变成流星之前）时，由于高速飞行，它的前端与空气强烈摩擦发热。

sentences.sContent: Turn the globe by just a few hours earlier on that day in June and the meteoroid would have been over the border of Pakistan and India–exactly where everyone was fearing a nuclear attack.
sentences.sContent_eng: Turn the globe by just a few hours earlier on that day in June and the meteoroid would have been over the border of Pakistan and India–exactly where everyone was fearing a nuclear attack.
sentences.sCn: 如果六月的这天，地球转动退回到几小时前，流星降落的地方就正好是巴基斯坦和印度的交界处，世人唯恐发生核战的交界地。

words.tran: 流星；[气象] 大气现象

trans.tranOther: any of the small celestial bodies that are thought to orbit the sun, possibly as the remains of comets
